cancer_focus.related_syndrome_or_condition: Immunosuppression-related conditions (organ transplant recipients, hematological malignancies, HIV infection)

treatment_plans.recommendation_content: Wide Local Excision (WLE) with 1–2 cm margins; Mohs surgery acceptable in selected cases. Adjuvant radiotherapy (RT) mandatory for tumors ≥1 cm, high-risk features, or margins <1 cm (50–60 Gy to tumor bed). Sentinel lymph node biopsy (SLNB) recommended for clinically node-negative disease.
treatment_plans.esmo_evidence_level: Level III (for SLNB), Level IV (for RT)

treatment_plans.recommendation_content: Adjuvant RT ± Complete Lymph Node Dissection (CLND)

Wide Local Excision (WLE) with 1–2 cm margins + mandatory adjuvant RT (50–60 Gy). For clinically positive nodes: CLND + adjuvant RT or definitive RT if inoperable. For in-transit metastases: Surgery/RT or isolated limb perfusion.
Nodal dissection + adjuvant RT (treated as stage IIIB)
First-line immunotherapy: Avelumab (anti-PD-L1), Pembrolizumab (anti-PD-1), Retifanlimab (anti-PD-1), or Nivolumab (investigational)
Second-line: Palliative RT or chemotherapy (platinum-etoposide, taxanes). Third-line: Best supportive care or clinical trials
Surgical resection or stereotactic RT if feasible

biomarker_clinical_significance.clinical_significance: Diagnostic: IHC panel (CK20, chromogranin A, synaptophysin, CD56) confirms MCC. Prognostic: Favorable—CD8+ T-cell infiltration, MCPyV positivity; Unfavorable—p63 expression, high mitotic rate, lymphovascular invasion. Non-predictive for therapy: PD-L1 expression, tumor mutational burden.
